description: From Medieval Latin perquīsītum (“something acquired for profit”).

entries.meaning: (chiefly in the plural) Any monetary or other incidental benefit beyond salary.
examples: The perquisites of this job include health insurance and a performance bonus.
After the wonderful service that evening he didn’t hesitate in laying a substantial perquisite on the table.

entries.meaning: A privilege or possession held or claimed exclusively by a certain person, group or class.
examples: Private jets and motor yachts are  perquisites of the rich.
